reference.shortdesc: A consequence is a result or effect of an action or condition. In the context of a hazard statement, it is the result of failing to avoid a hazard.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The consequence element is specialized from div. It is defined in the hazard-statement domain module.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows the markup for a hazard statement that warns about hot surfaces. The consequence element provides information about what might happen: "Contact might cause a burn."
example.codeblock: <hazardstatement type="caution"> <messagepanel> <typeofhazard> <hazardsymbol keyref="hazard-hotsurface"/> HOT SURFACES </typeofhazard> <consequence>Contact may cause a burn.</consequence> <howtoavoid>Wear gloves before servicing internal parts.</howtoavoid> </messagepanel> </hazardstatement>
